laboratory_examinations.findings: 199 mg/dL (11.0 mmol/L) - outside normal range (reference range, 70 to 110 mg/dL)
217 U/L - outside normal range (reference range, 110 to 210 U/L)
Two adjacent masses in the left occipital and posterior parietal regions with mass effect and abnormal signal hyperintensity
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: On the second day, an MRI showed two heterogeneous lesions with restricted diffusion and extensive signal abnormality; on follow-up MRI three months after surgery, new enhancement was noted.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Irregular enhancement and mass effect around the surgical cavity, extensive edema observed
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI at 18 months showed reduced enhancement and mass effect.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Extensive necrotic debris with microcalcifications, some atypical glial cells, no solid tumor present - consistent with pseudoprogression
Densely cellular, viable, and mitotically active tumor, diagnostic of recurrent glioblastoma
